title: JD.com Founder Donates More Than $2 Billion in Stock
sub_head: CEO Richard Liu is the latest Chinese billionaire to make a sizable donation to charity during Beijing’s regulatory crackdown on the country’s tech sector
body:
Richard Liu, founder and chief executive officer of Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com Inc., is giving billions of dollars of stock to charity, the latest member of the country’s business elite to make a large donation amid a government crackdown on China’s tech sector.
Mr. Liu plans to donate 62.4 million shares to a third-party charitable organization, the Beijing-based company said in a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
